citations.narrative:
A primary enclosure used for the four sea lions had an accumulation of fallen leaves within a back part of the enclosure
along an approximately 10-15 ft section between some large rocks and the enclosure fence. Some areas appeared to
have accumulations of approximately 3-4 inches deep. Accumulations of leaves and debris can provide harborage for
rodents or other pests which may spread disease or cause other health hazards.
Buildings and grounds, as well as exhibition areas, must be kept clean and in good repair for the health and well-being of
the animals. A system of timely and effective housekeeping must be in place.
Correct by 09/05/2025.

citations.desc: Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control.
citations.narrative:
The keeper area directly behind the penguin exhibit had a large accumulation of fallen leaves. Approximately half of the
ground in the area was covered in leaves with some areas being 3-4 inches deep along the walls. Accumulations of
leaves and debris can provide harborage of pests which may spread disease or other hazards. Premises where housing
facilities are located, including buildings, surrounding grounds, and exhibit areas must be kept clean and in good repair in
order to protect the birds from injury or disease, to facilitate the required husbandry practices, and to reduce or eliminate
breeding and living areas for rodents, pests, and vermin.
Correct by 09/05/2025.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
n

narrative:
3.107(c) 
   
Sanitation. 
A primary enclosure used for the four sea lions had an accumulation of fallen leaves within a back part of the enclosure 
along an approximately 10-15 ft section between some large rocks and the enclosure fence. Some areas appeared to 
have accumulations of approximately 3-4 inches deep. Accumulations of leaves and debris can provide harborage for 
rodents or other pests which may spread disease or cause other health hazards.  
Buildings and grounds, as well as exhibition areas, must be kept clean and in good repair for the health and well-being of 
the animals. A system of timely and effective housekeeping must be in place. 
 
Correct by 09/05/2025. 
3.158(c) 
   
Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control. 
The keeper area directly behind the penguin exhibit had a large accumulation of fallen leaves. Approximately half of the 
ground in the area was covered in leaves with some areas being 3-4 inches deep along the walls. Accumulations of 
leaves and debris can provide harborage of pests which may spread disease or other hazards. Premises where housing 
facilities are located, including buildings, surrounding grounds, and exhibit areas must be kept clean and in good repair in 
order to protect the birds from injury or disease, to facilitate the required husbandry practices, and to reduce or eliminate 
breeding and living areas for rodents, pests, and vermin. 
 
Correct by 09/05/2025. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
